  1. News & Announcements
    Connect with the City.

  1. Think Spring! Free Rain Garden Workshop April 9

    At this workshop, Dakota County residents will see how others have created native gardens, rain gardens and shoreline planting projects that benefit local water quality and help pollinators – as well as the many benefits of using native plants. Dakota County Soil & Water Conservation District

  2. Water Conservation Pledge

    Join the City of Burnsville in reducing water consumption and energy usage. We need your help to make our city “Water Wise.” Take the Water Conservation Pledge before April 30 to be entered to win great prizes! Take the Pledge

  3. Pre-Order Trees for Pick Up at Arbor Day Tree Sale

    Adding a tree to a property can reduce energy bills, help protect water quality and add beauty. The City sells bare root trees at its annual Arbor Day Tree Sale. New this year – trees will be sold via online pre-order ONLY. There will be no day-of sales. Order Online...

  4. 2019 Spring Recreation Times

    Get up and go with a variety of sports, programs, activities and events for all ages. The Recreation Times magazine outlines spring and summer opportunities. Read It Online...

  5. Senior Safety Academy

    Burnsville Police and Fire personnel will be offering five weekly safety sessions to residents age 62 and older April 10 through May 8. Topics will include scams, ID theft, personal/home safety, K-9 demos, fire prevention and more. Register by April 5. Register Now...
View All News

Minnesota state law requires that the three highest paid positions be posted annually for the City of Burnsville. Effective January 14, 2019: City Manager - $170,000; Police Chief - $148,963, and Fire Chief - $148,963.
